content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I learned what supersampling is, thanks to this puzzle...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Ascii art anti-aliasing is cool.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: + Who doesn't like a nice little ascii puzzle ?
+ Cases are thoroughly crafted.
+ Medium is fitting as x axis being a different ratio from y axis adds a little overhead complexity.

~ The case where the entirety of the frame is inside the ri (= blank canvas) could be covered.

I believe "Annulli" in the title should be written as "Annuli".

Nice job!

Goal
* Paragraph 1: Suggest to change "provided as" to "defined by".

* Except for the space, please format the characters to use (., :, -, etc., as well as -, | and +) as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

* "for i and j": Please format "i" and "j" as [[variables]].

* Please correct the typo: "supersamling".

* Please add a space after the commas following the coordinates of the four supersampling points for clarity. Better yet, add a space after all x-coordinates too (this latter suggestion also applies to paragraph 1 and the formula near the end).

* Formula near the end: Please format "cx" and "cy" as [[variables]].

Output
* Please change "[[height+2]]" and "[[width+2]]" to "[[height]]+2" and "[[width]]+2" respectively.

Constraints
* Please change "w" and "h" to "width" and "height" respectively.

Stub generator
* Please change "x" and "y" to "cx" and "cy" respectively.

* Suggest to delete "loop height" to avoid confusion (there should be height + 2 rows instead).

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Cases
* Validator 4: The case name is missing.

* Please split the last pair of cases into two pairs, as Test 8 is the only case where the ring's center has negative coordinates.

* Please add some more pairs of cases where the ring's center has negative coordinates (and in some of these cases the ring is actually a disc).

* Please add some cases where the ring's center has a mix of positive and negative coordinates (both +x, –y and –x, +y, in separate pairs of cases) (and in some of these cases the ring is actually a disc).

Thanks.
Thanks, I have made all the suggested changes. There are 12 test cases now, which should cover all relevant cases.
"Annuli" - totally right,fixed it. Test case for empty canvas (inside ring): done.
